definition.name: NXcoordinate_system
definition.doc:
Base class to detail a coordinate system (CS).
Whenever possible an instance of coordinate system should be used as a member in an NXcoordinate_system_set and the name of the instance should be this alias. This may support a process whereby jargon when talking about coordinate systems and conventions may become cleaner for users because it is not evident for people outside a lab that the terms tip space, specimen space, refer to the same coordinate system. This is an example of jargon used in e.g. the field of atom probe tomography.

field.name: origin
field.doc: Human-readable field telling where the origin of this CS is. Exemplar values could be *left corner of the lab bench*, *door-handle* *pinhole through which the electron beam exists the pole piece*. *barycenter of the triangle*, *center of mass of the stone*.

field.name: alias
field.doc: An alternative name given that that coordinate system.

field.name: x
field.doc: Base unit vector along the first axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the x-axis in real space and the i-axis in reciprocal space.

field.name: y
field.doc: Base unit vector along the second axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the y-axis in real space and the j-axis in reciprocal space.

field.name: z
field.doc: Base unit vector along the second axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the z-axis in real space and the k-axis in reciprocal space.
